section name: Using secondary sources to support your argument
tier 1 description: Argument is supported with five or more exceptionally specific, clear, & relevant examples from secondary sources. These sources are scholarly, well-understood, and have proper citations.
tier 2 description: Argument is supported with 3-4 specific, clear, & relevant examples from scholarly secondary sources and citations are included.
tier 3 description: Argument is supported with  two or three specific examples from scholarly secondary sources or the examples are weak or unclear or from general interest websites or uncited.
tier 4 description: Vague, unclear, and/or irrelevant support from secondary sources. No citations.

section name: Using supporting evidence from class materials
tier 1 description: Three or more specific, clear, & relevant examples from class materials are provided as supporting evidence for your argument. Examples include proper citations.
tier 2 description: A couple examples from class materials are provided as supporting evidence & most of the evidence is specific, clear, relevant & cited.
tier 3 description: One or two examples from class materials are provided as supporting evidence & some of the evidence provided is specific, clear, & relevant to your argument.
tier 4 description: One example from class materials is provided as supporting evidence and/or the evidence provided is vague, unclear, and/or irrelevant. Lacks proper citations
tier 5 description: No examples are provided from class materials as supporting evidence.

section name: Reflecting on Historical Context (Why is this subject memorialized, why in this place, what is the narrative presented, who is it for, how does that fit into US or NYC history?)
tier 1 description: The essay includes several exceptionally specific, clear, & relevant reflections on the historical context of this course. Analysis of the subject and its connections to place, time, people, etc. are clear and well-understood.
tier 2 description: The essay includes some specific, clear, & relevant reflections on the historical context of this course. Analysis of the subject and its connections to place, time, people, etc. are mostly clear and understood.
tier 3 description: The essay includes one or two somewhat specific, clear, and/or relevant reflections on the historical context of this course. Includes some thoughtful analysis of context.
tier 4 description: The essay includes vague, unclear, and/or mostly irrelevant reflections on the historical context of the monument. Contains little thoughtful analysis of subject.
tier 5 description: The essay does not reflect on the historical context of the monument or provide significant analysis.

tier 1 description: Paper is clear, concise, & well organized, with interpretive panel text presented separately from the essay. Panel text is exceptionally thoughtful, or creatively presented. Thoughts are expressed in a highly coherent & logical manner. There are no spelling, grammar, or syntax errors or other construction mistakes. Bibliography is complete & correct.
tier 2 description: Paper is mostly clear, concise, & well organized. Ideas & information are expressed in a basically coherent & logical manner. Panel text is interesting and informative. Bibliography is mostly complete & correct.
tier 3 description: Paper is somewhat clear and organized. There are numerous spelling, grammar, or syntax errors. Panel text lacks creativity or effort. Bibliography is incomplete or has numerous errors
tier 4 description: Paper is mostly unclear and/or disorganized. There are numerous spelling, grammar, or syntax errors. No effort made on interpretive panel, or panel is missing entirely. Bibliography is incomplete or unclear.
tier 5 description: Paper is totally unclear and/or disorganized. There are numerous spelling, grammar, or syntax errors. No interpretive panel. No bibliography.
